sprouts

Interface Action<D>

  • Type Parameters:
    D - The type of the delegate that will be passed to this event handler.
    All Superinterfaces:
    Subscriber
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    WeakAction<O,D>
    Functional Interface:
    This is a functional interface and can therefore be used as the assignment target for a lambda expression or method reference.

    @FunctionalInterface
public interface Action<D>
extends Subscriber
    A functional interface for observing state changes and performing some action in response. The action is being informed of the change through a delegate object denoted by the type parameter D.

    Implementations of this are usually triggered by UI components or properties to cause some sort of binding effect.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void accept(D delegate)
      Executes the action.
      default Action<D> andThen(Action<D> other)
      Returns a new Action that will execute this action and then the given action.
      static <O,D> WeakAction<O,D> ofWeak(O owner, java.util.function.BiConsumer<O,D> action)
      A factory method for creating a new Action instance with a weakly referenced owner.

    • Method Detail

      • ofWeak

        static <O,D> WeakAction<O,D> ofWeak(O owner,
                                    java.util.function.BiConsumer<O,D> action)
        A factory method for creating a new Action instance with a weakly referenced owner. When the owner is garbage collected then the action will no longer be executed and eventually be garbage collected itself.
        Keep in mind that the owner and action may only be garbage collected if there are no other strong references to them. This includes the action itself, which may not hold a strong reference to the owner! In order to allow you to access the owner of the action, it is passed as a parameter to the supplied BiConsumer as the first argument.
        Type Parameters:
        D - The type of the delegate that will be passed to this event handler.
        O - The type of the owner.
        Parameters:
        owner - The owner of the action, which is weakly referenced and determines the lifetime of the action.
        action - A BiConsumer that takes in the owner and the delegate and is executed when the action is triggered.
        Returns:
        A new Action instance with a weakly referenced owner.

      • accept

        void accept(D delegate)
        Executes the action.
        Parameters:
        delegate - A delegate for providing relevant context to the action.

      • andThen

        default Action<D> andThen(Action<D> other)
        Returns a new Action that will execute this action and then the given action.
        Parameters:
        other - The other action to execute after this one.
        Returns:
        A new Action that will execute this action and then the given action.
